intro: Reholttumia truncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a short stem and produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Reholttumia truncata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
